User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

When the Download manager is opened, it's window will have the focus and will be "highlighted" by being darker, while Firefox will be sent to the background and thus in a lighter color. However, there seems to be some Problem with this as Firefox is not repainted immediately so parts of it remain looking like it was in the foreground. 

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. (maybe optional) turn off automatic opening of the download manager
2. (maybe optional) download a file
3. press command+J to open download manager
Actual Results:  
As the download manager or any other window is dragged over Firefox, it repaints that part, but the rest of it doesn't. Occasionally, it repaints itself after a few seconds, at other times it appears fine. 

Expected Results:  
It should have repainted itself (which sometimes it does, sometimes it doesn't)

Using: MacBook Pro 2011 13" (probably irrelevant)
Mac OS X 10.6.7 (I have only seen this bug on OS X so far)
